member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IAdapter.CanEnqueueDataItems
member.summary:
Flags whether or not the Adapter can store reported DataItem value from its source. The internal queue can ensure that all values reported from the data source are pushed thru the implemented stream.
Setting this to false will automatically send the entire queue thru the stream.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IAdapter.CanValidateDataItems
member.summary: Flags whether or not the Adapter should validate all DataItems before publishing them.

member.summary: Refers to the category for the MTConnect observational type.

member.summary: A reference to the according the MTConnect Standard. See EventTypes, SampleTypes, and ConditionTypes for examples.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.SubTypeEnum
member.summary: A reference to the according to the MTConnect Standard and the provided TypeEnum if it is decorated with ObservationalSubTypeAttribute.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.TypeValidated
member.summary: A flag for whether or not the has been validated against the MTConnect Standard.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.ObservationalType
member.summary: The intended type for the Data Item. See Events, Samples, and Conditions. The type can also be extended according to the standard be adding the prefix x: to indicate an extended type.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.ObservationalSubType
member.summary: The intended subType for the Data Item. Refer to the appropriate Events, Samples, and Conditions. The subType can also be extended according to the standard be adding the prefix x: to indicate an extended type.

member.summary: Reference to the nativeUnits of the DataItem

member.summary: The name of the data item.

member.summary: A description of the DataItem such as a trace of its source or the methodology for a composite data type.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.DevicePrefix
member.summary: Optional device prefix.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.Value
member.summary: Get and set the Value property. This will check if the value has changed and set the changed flag appropriately. Automatically boxes types so will work for any data.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.LastChanged
member.summary: Timestamp of when the was last Changed.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.HasChanged
member.summary: A flag to indicate if the data item's value has changed since it has last been set.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.HasNewLine
member.summary: An indicator that this data item must be sent on a separate line. This is done for all data items that are more complex than simple Key|Value pairs.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.HasTimestampOverride
member.summary: Flag for whether or not this DataItem has a different source for the expected output Timestamp.

member.name: P:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.FormatValue
member.summary: An expression that can be used to apply additional formatting or transformations to the DataItem value.

member.summary: Make this data item UNAVAILABLE.

member.summary: Forces this to indicate that the has changed.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.Begin
member.summary: These methods are mainly for conditions. They allow for mark and sweep of the condition activations.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.Prepare
member.summary: This is called before we send the actual changed data. It does the diff from the previous state and finds all the activations that need to be removed. This also check to see if all the activations have been removed because we only need to do a single normal with no native code to clear all. This is not required for simple conditions.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.Cleanup
member.summary: Reset the Changed flag.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.IDataItem.ItemList(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a list of all the changed data items. Since this is a single value, just return a list with one item if it has changed
member.param: true means to return this data item regardless of the changed flag. This is used to send initial data back to a new client.

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.UPnP.IUPnPService.Start(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Begins periodically broadcasting connection information for the Adapter. This method immediately sends a message too.
member.param: An optional cancellation token to automatically stop broadcasting

member.name: M:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.UPnP.IUPnPService.Stop
member.summary: Stops the periodic broadcasting of connection information for the Adapter.
